Frequently Asked Questions

What factors determine if schools close for snow?

Schools consider temperature, snow accumulation, road conditions, visibility, and wind chill. Most districts close when temperatures drop below 0째F or when snow accumulation exceeds 2-3 inches.

How accurate are snow day predictions?

Weather predictions are generally accurate 3-5 days in advance, but snow day decisions depend on local conditions and school district policies. Our calculator provides probability estimates based on historical data.

What's the difference between a snow day and a cold day?

Snow days are called for snow accumulation and poor road conditions. Cold days are called for extreme temperatures (typically below -10째F) that make it unsafe for students to wait for buses or walk to school.

How do I prepare for a potential snow day?

Check weather forecasts regularly, have backup childcare plans, stock up on essentials, and stay informed about school district announcements. Our calculator helps you plan ahead for winter weather.

Can I use this calculator for work closures too?

Yes, many workplaces follow similar weather closure policies. Our calculator can help predict work closures based on weather conditions and local business practices.
